us.title: Progressive: Fundamentally Strong, But Earning Multiples Are Elevated, Hold For Now
us.content: Progressive Corp reported strong Q4 and FY results, with a 21% increase in net written premiums and over 5 million new policies in 2024. The company is well-positioned for 2025, with improved pricing expected to support margin expansion and EPS growth, despite a slightly elevated valuation multiple. Risks include market saturation, potential recession impacts, and a slowdown in growth rates, which could affect investor expectations and valuation.

us.title: Market Correction Is A Call For Portfolio Correction
us.content: The recent 10% drawdown in the S&P 500 is a healthy, timely correction, offering potential buying opportunities (perhaps) in the less shining corners of the markets. Despite higher credit spreads, they're still within a stable range, not indicating recessionary concerns, actually suggesting a return to normal market conditions.

us.title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says corrections are 'healthy' and 'normal.' Jim Cramer disagrees
us.content: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Monday parsed recent market action, saying the reason the S&P 500 plummeted into correction territory last week is not typical. "Right now, people are worried about a recession that's caused by the President of the United States," he said.

us.title: Metaplanet Expands Bitcoin Holdings Amid Market Corrections and Strategic Financing
us.content: Metaplanet Inc. (Tokyo: 3350), a fast-growing company through a Bitcoin (BTC) treasury strategy, has strengthened its balance sheet with more Bitcoins amid the ongoing market correction. The mid-capped company, with a market capitalization of about ¥175 billion, announced an acquisition of an additional 150 Bitcoins.

us.title: One thing to watch as recession fears strike fast-casual restaurant stocks
us.content: Chipotle (CMG) stock is down more than 17% since the start of 2025. Bank of America Securities senior restaurant analyst Sara Senatore joins Market Domination with Julie Hyman and BD8 Capital Partners CEO and CIO Barbara Doran to discuss the stock and explain why she holds a Buy rating for the stock.

us.title: Crocs Is Positioned For Long-Term Outperformance
us.content: Crocs' core shoe business remains high-quality with respectable growth prospects, trading at an EV/EBIT multiple of less than 8x, suggesting significant undervaluation. The HEYDUDE acquisition has been challenging, but the core Crocs brand's impressive operating and financial metrics justify a higher stock price. The free cash flow from Crocs' core brand and the company's share buyback plans make it an attractive investment with significant potential outperformance prospects.

us.title: Ed Yardeni: 'Fed put' a 'very plausible scenario' amidst rising U.S. recession risks
us.content: Ed Yardeni of Yardeni Research says Trump's tariffs are looking increasingly permanent, and less of a negotiation tactic. He discusses the likelihood of a 'Trump put' following his comments on the U.S. stock market performance.

us.title: Most business people I stalk to are worried about U.S. dipping into a recession, says Jim Cramer
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer looks at what is moving the market right now.

us.title: China's Stimulus Push: Wage Hikes, Rate Cuts, and AI-Driven Growth
us.content: Beijing's new economic measures aim to spur consumption, but rising unemployment threatens sentiment. Will China's policy efforts be enough?

us.title: Nutanix Is A Winner
us.content: Nutanix has transformed from a cash-burning company to a cash-producing machine, excelling in the IT infrastructure market with its leading HCI and enterprise cloud platform. The company is experiencing growth through new customer wins, upselling, and strategic partnerships, with significant financial improvements driven by operating leverage. Nutanix's GPT-in-a-Box simplifies generative AI adoption, enhancing productivity and efficiency for enterprises, and is supported by partnerships with Nvidia and Hugging Face.

us.title: US stocks close higher, Trump focused on tariffs, plus how levies are impacting the supply chain
us.content: Market Domination Overtime anchor Julie Hyman reports on stocks closing higher following last week's sell-off. Next, President Trump's messaging is now focusing more on tariffs than taxes.

us.title: Fed Atlanta GDP Forecast Sends a Warning
us.content: Anna Edwards, Kriti Gupta, Guy Johnson, and Ven Ram break down today's key themes for analysts and investors on "Bloomberg: The Opening Trade." -------- More on Bloomberg Television and Markets Like this video?

us.title: Tesla Stock Falls Further. This Is Why Wall Street Is Worried.
us.content: Falling delivery estimates are trumping any potential benefit from self-driving cars.

us.title: Got $300? Buy These 3 Top Dividend Stocks and Never Look Back.
us.content: Some companies are just better than others at paying dividends. They offer higher-yielding payouts that they steadily increase in good times and bad.

france.title: Bank of Korea Rejects Bitcoin for Reserves, Citing High Volatility and Liquidity Concerns
france.content: South Korea's central bank has ruled out adding bitcoin to its foreign exchange reserves, citing extreme price volatility and failure to meet liquidity and investment-grade standards. This stance follows U.S. President Donald Trump's March 6 executive order promoting bitcoin stockpiling. The Bank of Korea, responding to a query from Rep.

france.title: RBC Capital Previews General Mills' Upcoming Q3 Earnings
france.content:
RBC Capital analysts maintained a Sector Perform rating on General Mills (NYSE:GIS) with a $70 price target, highlighting ongoing challenges in the packaged food industry that could weigh on the company’s near-term performance.

Retailer inventory fluctuations, weak signals from competitors, and broader economic and political uncertainty continue to create a difficult operating environment for General Mills. In light of these pressures, RBC revised its third-quarter (scheduled to be released on March 19) organic growth forecast downward to -3.1%, compared to the consensus estimate of -2.7%. Earnings per share projections remain at $0.96, aligning with market expectations.

With a soft quarter anticipated, RBC suggests full-year organic growth guidance may be revised lower, with earnings likely to hover near the lower end of the current forecast range. The firm expects General Mills to reinforce its cautious outlook, acknowledging the persistent headwinds in the packaged food sector.

While General Mills remains a steady player in the industry, near-term performance is likely to be constrained as consumer uncertainty and market volatility continue to impact demand.

france.title: Tempus AI: The Investment Opportunity Of A Decade, Strong Buy
france.content: Tempus AI's financials have significantly improved, with positive cash flow expected next quarter and strong revenue growth projected for FY25. Q4FY24 saw record revenues, driven by a 35.8% YoY growth, with the Data & Services segment growing by 44.6% YoY. FY24 revenues hit an all-time high of $693.4 million, with major agreements signed and the launch of the AI-enabled health app, Olivia.

france.title: Shoals Technologies: 2025 Presents A Large Accumulation Window
france.content: Solar and batteries will be the largest new source of generation capacity in 2025. Shoals' growth has slowed, but their balance sheet continues to improve while they maintain backlog. Shoals share price has fallen into value territory, presenting investors an opportunity to accumulate shares.

france.title: Standard Chartered Cuts Ethereum Price Forecast by 60% for 2025, Citing Increased Competition and Declining Revenue
france.content: Standard Chartered has revised its Ethereum (ETH) price forecast for 2025, cutting it by 60%. The bank now expects Ethereum to reach just $4,000 by the end of the year.

france.title: Crypto ETPs Face $1.7 Billion in Outflows as Bitcoin Products See Continued Decline for Fifth Consecutive Week
france.content: Crypto exchange-traded products (ETPs) saw significant outflows last week, with $1.7 billion withdrawn, continuing a streak of negative flows for the fifth consecutive week.

france.title: China Literature Announces 2024 Annual Results
france.content: HONG KONG , March 18, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- China Literature Limited ("China Literature" or "the Company", stock code: 0772), a leading online literature and intellectual property ("IP") incubation platform in China, today announced the audited consolidated results for the year ended December 31, 2024. Results Highlights  (1) Total revenues increased by 15.8% year-over-year to RMB8,121.1 million (USD1,129.7 million).
